review_blob:
First time having this on tap.  Decent color with a great after taste.
A lot of malt, vastly overweighs the hops (Which Im not a fan of). But a solid beer all around

Aroma is the beast that haunts the nose that smells this. The taste lacks a little against the other farmhouse ales, but still a strong beer by itself at only 7.7 ABV. I would be interested to know the hops used in thus. A very fruity palate finished with a smooth drawn-out finish. Tip and enjoy!

A mild caramel aroma emanates from the golden/amber orange body.  It has a loose white head, comparable to the boulevard pilsner.  There is a light sour and bitterness to it, but as it goes down the hops begin to come out and linger on the back of the tongue.  I love the level of carbonation, fits very much unlike OJ and his leather gloves.  This is a badass pilsner for badass people.
beer_name: Boulevard Smokestack Series - Reverb Imperial Pilsner

review_blob: Doughy, earthy nose that pours with a thick dark cream-colored head.  A red/brown body that is largely hazy.  It goes down with a creamy feel.  Overall, a pretty good beer.  It has a great lasting after taste that hangs around your mouth for minutes after the sip.
banana, ginger, and roasty nose paired with a hay-yellow body.  A light-medium ale with a long fizzy after taste.  Overall, not too bad... looking for more on the palate.
Pours a thick white head, with a pale/golden body. Hoppy, hay like nose.  Citrus and hoppy finish with a very earthy quality that carries throughout the bottle.

Pours an amber orange with little head.   Haystack aroma, a slight bubblegum nose as well.  Lively CO2 burst of banaona and bubblegum, brettanomyces yeast, and a lingering creamy feel.  Overall, a good Belgian Ale from a great brewery in an unhappy city.
An 1980s Mike Tyson taped a wad of hops to his hand.  And proceeded to hit me in the mouth.  Great golden color with a hoppy, doughy, slightly woody head.  Hints of grapefruit on the tail end.
